item.title: Report X-2024070959
item.description:
Report X-2024070959

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

item.title: Report E-2024070268
item.description:
Report E-2024070268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of gasoline was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, air monitors, an air circulator, cleaners, and absorbents to remediate the impacted trailer and freight. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon lined and vented drums.

item.title: Report E-2024070190
item.description:
Report E-2024070190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 2, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 arrived on its side and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews uprighted the fallen tote, inspected it, and remediated it as required. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070184
item.description:
Report E-2024070184

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 1ft-by-5ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to damage on two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. EnviroServe personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with impacted cardboard. The two 92) damaged drums were overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum and one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
